qas.question: Whose methods did Tito use to fight Yugoslav Stalinists?
Who used inhumane methods against oponents through the UBDA?
Until what year did the repression of the UBDA last?
The work of the UBDA was due to tension between Yugoslavia and what country?
What is another name for the UBDA?

context: One significant consequence of the tension arising between Yugoslavia and <a3_0>Soviet Union<a3_0/>, was that Tito fought Yugoslav Stalinists with <a0_0>Stalin<a0_0/>'s methods. In other words, Aleksandar <a1_0>Ranković<a1_0/> and the <a4_0>State Security Service<a4_0/> (UBDA) employed the same inhumane methods against their opponents as Stalin did in the Soviet Union against his. Not every person accused of a political crime was convicted and nobody was sentenced to death for his or her pro-Soviet feelings. However this repression, which lasted until <a2_0>1956<a2_0/>, was marked by significant violations of human rights.
